intro: Verbesina capituliparva, commonly known as the small-headed beggarticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in compact clusters, which attract various pollinators. Its stems are hairy and often have a reddish tinge, while its leaves are alternate and have a rough texture. Verbesina capituliparva is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
